snippet: The special prosecutor in the shooting death of the 17-year-old in Sanford, Fla., said Wednesday that George Zimmerman would appear before a magistrate in the next 24 hours.
abstract: Special prosecutor Angela B Corey files second degree murder charges against George Zimmerman, neighborhood watch coordinator who is accused of shooting and killing 17-year-old Trayvon Martin in Sanford, Fla; if convicted, Zimmerman could face life in prison; charges open new chapter in a case that set off national discussion of racial profiling, Florida's self-defense law and the fairness of the criminal justice system.

byline.original: By LIZETTE ALVAREZ and MICHAEL COOPER
byline.contributor: Lizette Alvarez reported from Jacksonville, and Michael Cooper from New York. Serge F. Kovaleski contributed reporting from Sanford, Michael S. Schmidt from Washington, and Timothy Williams from New York. Jack Styczynski contributed research.

lead_paragraph: The special prosecutor in the shooting death of the 17-year-old in Sanford, Fla., said Wednesday that George Zimmerman would appear before a magistrate in the next 24 hours.

headline.seo: Zimmerman to Be Charged in Trayvon Martin Shooting
headline.main: Prosecutor Files Charge of 2nd-Degree Murder in Shooting of Martin
headline.print_headline: Prosecutor Files Charge Of 2nd-Degree Murder In Shooting of Martin
headline.sub: Zimmerman in Custody in Death of Trayvon Martin
